result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   

Both State an Defense have a copy of Dr. Manos' evaluation/report.
Dr. Manos finds that the defendant is competent to proceed.
Both State and Defense are in agreement to Dr. Manos' evaluation/report and not requesting an additional evaluation.

Court accepts Dr. Manos' evaluation and finds the defendant is competent to proceed at this time.

Matter is dismissed and read into case:  15CF818
for Services Rendered filed by Dr. Manos.
filed by Dr. Manos. Report maintained in file 15CF818.

Inmate Communication Form, filed by the Defendant, informing the court she is competent and requesting to move up her court date.

Copy sent to the DA and Atty. Guza.

Order Vacating the Finding of NGI Entered on 10/14/15.

Review hearing at 01-07-2016 10:15 am

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   
Motion filed by Atty. Guza - Vacate and Reconsider.

Atty. Guza presented statements to the court.
State is in agreement with the Motion.

Court on it's own motion is ordering a Competency Evaluation under 971.14. (court is not satisfied she is competent at this time) - on a custodial basis.
Evaluation to be filed by:  12/28/15.
Court will appoint Dr. Manos to conduct the competency.
Atty. Guza presented statements to the court.

Court Grants - Defense request and Vacates the Finding of NGI.
Court vacates the prior order for the Predispositional Investigation Order at this time.
  Review hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 10:15 am.
filed by defendant regarding her evaluation.

Defendant's Motion to Vacate and Reconsider, including cover letter, filed by Atty. Guza.

Order for Predisposition Investigation (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).

Order for Commitment (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 10/14/15.

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.  

All parties are in receipt of the NGI evaluation filed by Dr. Collins.
NGI evaluation finds the Defendant NGI at the time of the offenses.
Defense and State are not objecting to the evaluation or requesting a second evaluation.
Defense and State are in agreement with the evaluation.

Court accepts/receives the evaluation.
Court finds the Defendant NGI at the time of the Offense based on the evaluation.
Court orders the Defendant's Commitment to the Department of Health Services.
Court signed order in court for Commitment.
State, Defendant and Atty. Guza all received a copy of the order in court.

Court finds the defendant has 107 Days credit as of today's date.

Court also does order for Predisposition Investigation (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect).
Court orders the Report to be filed by:  12/14/15.
Court signed order.

Review hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
filed by Dr. Collins

Defendant Darlene M Spears in court, in custody, with attorney Jeremy J Guza.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense enters not guilty plea by mental disease.  Defense requests motion to modify bail.  State objects to modification.  Bail remains as fixed.  Bail deferred to Judge to address.  Hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Arraignment on August 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to have no contact with Tonya K. as listed in the Criminal Complaint.
